article: Some years ago an American policeman found a woman lying near a lonely road. She did not appear to have a / an _ , but she was trembling and clearly in a _ of shock, so he rushed her to the _ hospital. She began to tell the doctor on duty a story which was _ in all respects. She had been _ along a country road when she had been stopped by a flying saucer _ in front of her. She had been forced to leave the car and _ the flying saucer by creatures that looked _ human beings and which could easily make themselves _ although they could not speak. It was as though they could read her thoughts and she could read _ . They tested her politely and allowed her to _ after carrying out a number of tests on her. As she otherwise seemed to be _ , the doctor decided that she was probably suffering from the side effects of some medicine. The woman insisted on being _ to go home, but when she gave her _ , it was in a town over thousand miles from the _ . The police then started to make inquiries and soon _ that there was already a _ going on for the woman, whose husband sadly reported that she had _ . Her car had been found with the driver's door open and the engine running. In front of the car the surface of the road had been completely destroyed --- not by an explosion or anything of that kind, but as if a large, round, white-hot object had burnt through it.
